description: Seborrheic Keratosis is a common noncancerous skin growth that appears as a wart-like or waxy bump. It is usually brown, black, or light tan in color and can vary in size.
possible causes: Exact cause is unknown, but it may be related to genetics, sun exposure, or age.
symptoms: Raised, round or oval growths on the skin
treatments: No treatment necessary unless causing symptoms or for cosmetic reasons
